intro: Selaginella hengduanshanicola, commonly known as the Hengduan Mountains spikemoss, is a rare and recently described species of spikemoss native to China. It belongs to the family Selaginellaceae and is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and distinctive reproductive structures. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Its discovery highlights the rich biodiversity of the Hengduan Mountains and the ongoing exploration of plant life in understudied areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a conservation concern.
